headline: Fluffy Flapjack Pancakes
description: These flapjack pancakes are a delicious breakfast using pantry ingredients. Start your brunch with these filling, quick and easy fluffy flapjacks.

video.description: These flapjack pancakes are quick, easy, and turn out fluffy every time. The recipe can be easily adjusted to your dietary needs, too. I have tried many recipes; this one is simple, yummy, and fail-proof! A word of caution: they're very filling.
video.name: Fluffy Flapjack Pancakes Recipe

name: Fluffy Flapjack Pancakes

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a bowl until no lumps remain. Add milk, eggs, and oil; whisk until batter is runny and smooth.
Heat a nonstick griddle over medium heat and lightly coat with cooking spray.

Working in batches, ladle a generous 1/4 cup batter for each pancake onto the preheated grill and cook until bubbles appear, 3 to 4 minutes. Flip and cook, pressing middle gently with the spatula, until bottom is lightly browned, 2 to 3 minutes more. Repeat with remaining batter.

review.reviewBody: it good

This was easy to put together. I could tell by the liquid to dry ratio that they would be way to runny for our family so I dropped the milk to 1 3/4 c. I think I could have dropped it more, but for the time being we enjoyed these. I used olive oil due to the fact my Hubby seems to have this obsession with it right now. These came out great.
Amazing recipe! Left out the baking soda and it worked wonderfullyüòÅ

I tried these as per recipe, turned out excellent. I tried again without sugar for my toddler and worked well too. After flipping over, I just add bananas and berries. Must try if you have a fussy eater at home!
Absolutely fluffy and amazing .i also vannila essence into the mix..my üë∂Baby totally loves it...its amazing...they came out perfect...and makes more than 8 by the way...;)
Awesome üòé
So soft, fluffy and delicious!! Everything is perfect! Very easy to make.

Noticed that others weren't getting fluffy results. I always sift the dry ingredients together first. The instructions say to mix the batter until it's thin. I really think you should be gentle with the batter and allow some lumps. When the batter starts to bubble, gently scoop it and place it in the pan. You have to use the batter right away, or your pancakes will be flat. Also sub'd 2T melted butter for 1/4 c. of Canola. Vanilla would be a nice addition.
Came out perfect, but made more than 8
I love it and i just started
Yummy
So easy and tastes great!

I made an account just to leave this one star. It is by far the worst flapjack/pancake recipe that I have tried.
The batter is too runny to work for flapjacks. I tried to make pancakes (crepes) instead. It also does not work. Do yourself a favour and find any other recipe to try.
Good flavor. Easy recipe.
Worked out great... Just need to know how to make them into perfect circles...
I followed the recipe to a T and they did not come out fluffy at all. They were more like crepe consistency
Fantastic recipe. I used brown sugar and sunflower oil... delicious and fluffy
I thought they were too dense. The taste was good because I added cinnamon.
Easy to make.

I made the exact recipe. They were certainly not fluffy but flat and plain. My Grandsons (teenagers) left them on their plates after one bite!
I agree with the commentor who said she uses sour cream--yes, so do I!
The photo shows kind of fluffy but not actually how they come out.
My husband and I didn‚Äôt care for this recipe. Even added wild blueberries and it was still bland. Sorry. On to another recipe.

For my taste, these were ok. They cooked nicely but I thought they were a bit heavy and blah. I would try less sugar and add some vanilla, or use buttermilk if I were to make them again. I normally use a recipe (it‚Äôs more work though) that separates the egg and you fold in the whipped egg whites last. That makes a lighter fluffier pancake for sure.
just perfect
They were good but not what I would call Fluffy. I added mini chocolate chips.

These are advertised as fluffy pancakes which I did not find. I usually use a different recipe but thought I would try these out. I will go back to my ‚Äúgo to‚Äù recipe which has sour cream in it and makes the ‚Äúfluffiest ‚Äú pancakes
Delicious! My new go-to pancake recipe.
Worst pancake recipe ever!

Don‚Äôt know how you can get fluffy pancakes from ‚Äúrunny‚Äù batter but tried this recipe. Result: flat, thin pancakes, just like the batter. Pretty flat taste too. My husband said ‚ÄúAt least they‚Äôre edible‚Äù ‚Äî not high praise. Better recipes out there, and better pancakes.
Cooking times listed are too long. On my electric griddle you can cut the listed time in half.
\ I liked these a lot but something missing- can‚Äôt quite put my finger on it. I will make again though- easy and quick.
The recipe made 12 for me, rather than 8. Half will make a second meal for the two of us.
Best flapjack recipe I've ever tried, and I use it all the time now for my guests! So soft and fluffy and delicious! Thank you!!
Awesome awesome awesome very fluffy kids loved it to bits can i suggest adding caramel essance and a tad of vinilla kids seem to respond to its smell in the air

Definitely the softest and fluffiest Flapjacks I've ever tasted!
And don't leave that funny oily after taste that most flap jack recipes do.

Gone straight into my Favourites list!
